description: Fetches the execution history of the flow.

parameters.name: flowName
parameters.description: The specified name of the flow. Spaces are not allowed. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only.

nested_items.name: flowExecutions
nested_items.description: Returns a list of all instances when this flow was run.

nested_items.name: executionId
nested_items.description: Specifies the identifier of the given flow run.

nested_items.name: executionStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the flow run status and whether it is in progress, has completed successfully, or has failed.

nested_items.name: executionResult
nested_items.description: Describes the result of the given flow run.

nested_items.name: errorInfo
nested_items.description: Provides any error message information related to the flow run.

nested_items.name: putFailuresCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the failure count for the attempted flow.

nested_items.name: executionMessage
nested_items.description: Specifies the error message that appears if a flow fails.

nested_items.name: bytesProcessed
nested_items.description: The total number of bytes processed by the flow run.

nested_items.name: bytesWritten
nested_items.description: The total number of bytes written as a result of the flow run.

nested_items.name: recordsProcessed
nested_items.description: The number of records processed in the flow run.

nested_items.name: numParallelProcesses
nested_items.description: The number of processes that Amazon AppFlow ran at the same time when it retrieved your data.

nested_items.name: maxPageSize
nested_items.description: The maximum number of records that Amazon AppFlow receives in each page of the response from your SAP application.

nested_items.name: startedAt
nested_items.description: Specifies the start time of the flow run.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: Specifies the time of the most recent update.

nested_items.name: dataPullStartTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp that determines the first new or updated record to be transferred in the flow run.

nested_items.name: dataPullEndTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp that indicates the last new or updated record to be transferred in the flow run.

nested_items.name: metadataCatalogDetails
nested_items.description: Describes the metadata catalog, metadata table, and data partitions that Amazon AppFlow used for the associated flow run.

nested_items.name: catalogType
nested_items.description: The type of metadata catalog that Amazon AppFlow used for the associated flow run. This parameter returns the following value:

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table that stores the metadata for the associated flow run. The table stores metadata that represents the data that the flow transferred. Amazon AppFlow stores the table in the metadata catalog.

nested_items.name: tableRegistrationOutput
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the attempt from Amazon AppFlow to register the metadata table with the metadata catalog. Amazon AppFlow creates or updates this table for the associated flow run.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: Explains the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow. If the attempt fails, the message explains why.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of resources that Amazon AppFlow created or updated. Possible resources include metadata tables and data partitions.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow.

nested_items.name: partitionRegistrationOutput
nested_items.description: Describes the status of the attempt from Amazon AppFlow to register the data partitions with the metadata catalog. The data partitions organize the flow output into a hierarchical path, such as a folder path in an S3 bucket. Amazon AppFlow creates the partitions (if they don't already exist) based on your flow configuration.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: Explains the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow. If the attempt fails, the message explains why.

nested_items.name: result
nested_items.description: Indicates the number of resources that Amazon AppFlow created or updated. Possible resources include metadata tables and data partitions.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of the registration attempt from Amazon AppFlow.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token for the next page of data.
